metadata.title: CVE-2021-39633 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In gre_handle_offloads of ip_gre.c, there is a possible page fault due toan invalid memory access. This could lead to local information disclosurewith no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-150694665References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1126-azure - 4.15.0-1126.139~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1126.139~14.04.1').
